plugin_desc: Real-time collection of Apache runtime data, resource utilization, request processing efficiency, and bandwidth statistics, helping users optimize performance, diagnose issues, and achieve efficient operations management.
name: Apache

metrics.name: apache_uptime
metrics.description: This metric represents the uptime of the Apache server since it was started, used to monitor the server's health.

metrics.name: apache_busy_workers
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of busy worker processes in the Apache server, used to assess the server's load.

metrics.name: apache_idle_workers
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of idle worker processes in the Apache server, reflecting the server's resource utilization.

metrics.name: apache_req_per_sec
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of requests handled by Apache per second, used to monitor the server's request processing capability.

metrics.name: apache_bytes_per_sec
metrics.description: This metric represents the number of bytes transferred by Apache per second, reflecting the network traffic.

metrics.name: apache_total_accesses
metrics.description: This metric represents the total number of accesses to the Apache server since startup, reflecting the overall request volume.

metrics.name: apache_total_duration
metrics.description: This metric represents the total request processing duration since the Apache server started, used to assess the server's processing load.

metrics.name: apache_cpu_system
metrics.description: This metric represents the CPU usage at the system level for Apache server.

metrics.name: apache_cpu_user
metrics.description: This metric represents the CPU usage at the user process level for Apache server.

metrics.name: apache_cpu_load
metrics.description: This metric represents the CPU load of the Apache server, reflecting the overall load of the system.

metrics.name: apache_duration_per_req
metrics.description: This metric represents the average duration per request, helping to evaluate the efficiency of request handling by the server.
